resources.name: 2-1-1 Texas
resources.description: Free, anonymous 24/7 social service hotline connecting Texans to local resources including veteran services, housing, food, health, emergency assistance

resources.name: Texas Veterans Commission (TVC)
resources.description: State agency providing comprehensive veteran support including claims representation, employment services, benefits assistance, health advocacy, and grants to veteran organizations

resources.name: TexVet (Texas Veterans Portal)
resources.address: 3950 North A.W. Grimes Blvd, 2nd Floor, Round Rock, TX 78665
resources.description: Information and referral services with peer support specialists providing centralized access to veteran benefits and local resources

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 confidential crisis support for veterans and their loved ones

resources.name: Texas Veterans Land Board (VLB)
resources.description: Provides veteran housing loans, nursing homes, cemetery services, and property assistance programs

resources.name: U.S. VETS Houston
resources.description: Major veteran services organization since 1997 serving thousands of veterans with transitional, emergency and permanent supportive housing, mental health and substance use treatment, case management, and career services

resources.name: The Salvation Army - Carr P. Collins Social Services Center (Veteran Programs)
resources.description: Salvation Army Veterans Enrichment (SAVE) program provides permanent housing, comprehensive case management, and support services for chronically homeless disabled veterans

resources.name: Tunnel to Towers Foundation - Houston Veterans Village
resources.address: Houston area (specific address varies by program)
resources.description: National program providing permanent and transitional housing to homeless veterans with comprehensive supportive services

resources.name: Care Connection Aging & Disability Resource Center
resources.description: Free resource center specializing in locating public and private services for older adults, individuals with disabilities, and veterans

resources.name: Meals for Vets
resources.description: Provides consistent access to healthy, nutritious meals for veterans under age 60 who served honorably and are struggling financially. Meals delivered to veteran locations or shipped to residence

resources.name: Central Texas Aging, Disability & Veterans Resource Center
resources.description: Resource center for aging adults, individuals with disabilities, and veterans in Central Texas region

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: 24/7 hotline providing immediate assistance to veterans at risk of or experiencing homelessness

resources.name: Texas Health and Human Services (HHS) - Homelessness Assistance
resources.description: Provides homelessness assistance programs and direct grants to help Texans avoid homelessness and secure stable housing

resources.name: Texas Workforce Commission - Veterans Services
resources.description: Provides career development, job search resources, training programs, and employment support for Texas veterans

resources.name: VA Houston Health Care System - Homeless Veteran Care
resources.description: Federal VA program providing comprehensive care to homeless and at-risk veterans including housing, mental health, medical services, and case management

resources.name: Meals On Wheels of Tarrant County - Veterans Program
resources.description: Provides freshly-prepared meals, frozen meals, and congregate meals to eligible veterans

resources.name: Combined Arms - Veterans Mobile Food Pantry
resources.address: Multiple locations (Galveston, Ellington Field, Montgomery County)
resources.description: Mobile food pantries launched in 2022 to provide food assistance to veterans in the Greater Houston area
